title: Chapter One bookstore homepage UI (trending books + client-side cart)

requirements.summary: Create homepage header with logo, nav links, and a cart button that shows a dynamic item count from cart state.
acceptanceCriteria: Header contains the logo text and the four nav items.
Cart label displays a dynamic count (not hard-coded) based on current cart state.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the root page layout and render the header with logo text ‚ÄúChapter One üìö‚Äù and nav links (Home, Categories, Bestsellers) plus a cart button whose label reflects current cart item count.
Implement a small client-side cart store (React context + hook) exposing cart items, total count, and actions used by the header cart count.

requirements.summary: Implement the hero section with the exact headline, description, and CTA text, with modern storefront styling and accessible hover/focus states.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero shows the exact headline, description, and CTA text from the provided HTML.
CTA button is visually prominent and has hover/focus styles.

file_operations.description: Add the hero section containing the exact text: ‚ÄúFind Your Next Great Escape‚Äù, ‚ÄúFrom timeless classics to modern thrillers, we have it all.‚Äù, and CTA button ‚ÄúBrowse Collection‚Äù, with Tailwind hover/focus-visible styling.

requirements.summary: Render a responsive ‚ÄúTrending Books‚Äù grid with four book cards (cover image, title, author, Add to Cart).
acceptanceCriteria: Trending Books section displays the 4 books: The Great Gatsby, 1984, To Kill a Mockingbird, The Alchemist.
Each card shows: cover image, title, author, and an Add to Cart button.
Grid is responsive (1 column on small screens, increasing columns on wider screens).

file_operations.description: Define the four trending books (title, author, cover image asset path, and a stable id) as static data used to render the cards.
Render the ‚ÄúTrending Books‚Äù section and map over the four provided titles/authors to display responsive Tailwind grid cards with cover image, title, author, and an ‚ÄúAdd to Cart‚Äù button.

requirements.summary: Implement client-side cart behavior: Add to Cart updates header count immediately, and provide a cart drawer/modal/section to review and adjust cart contents.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Add to Cart updates the header cart count immediately.
Cart state persists at least for the current session (page not refreshed).
Cart button provides a way to view what was added (drawer/modal/section) and adjust quantities or remove items.

file_operations.description: Add cart actions (add item, remove item, increment/decrement quantity) and session persistence using sessionStorage so cart state survives navigation/re-renders within the session.
Create a simple cart drawer/modal/section component (Tailwind-styled) that lists added items with quantity controls and remove actions, and supports open/close state from the header cart button.
Wire ‚ÄúAdd to Cart‚Äù buttons to cartStore actions; wire the header cart button to open the cart panel; ensure cart count updates immediately.

requirements.summary: Add the footer with the exact provided copyright text.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer displays: ‚Äú¬© 2024 Chapter One Bookstore. All rights reserved.‚Äù

file_operations.description: Add the footer to the page and render the exact text ‚Äú¬© 2024 Chapter One Bookstore. All rights reserved.‚Äù

requirements.summary: Apply a warm, paper-and-ink bookstore aesthetic using Tailwind across header, hero, cards, buttons, and footer (avoid blue/purple primary palette).
acceptanceCriteria: Theme feels consistent across header, hero, cards, buttons, and footer.
Primary colors are not blue/purple-based; use a warm bookstore palette (e.g., parchment/cream, ink/dark, accent like burgundy/forest).
Typography and spacing are consistent and readable.

file_operations.description: Create global Tailwind base layer and CSS variables (or base styles) to establish a warm parchment/ink/burgundy (or forest) palette and consistent typography/spacing, ensuring the site avoids blue/purple primaries.
Apply consistent Tailwind classes for layout, typography, spacing, cards, and buttons to match a warm bookstore aesthetic across all sections.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions as needed to support the warm palette and typography choices used by the homepage (without introducing non-supported frameworks).

requirements.summary: Add required generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the hero and trending book cards.
acceptanceCriteria: All required images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Hero section uses the generated hero image as a background or prominent visual.
Each trending book card displays a corresponding generated cover placeholder image (not plain text 'Cover Art').

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero banner image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/chapter-one-hero.dim_1600x900.png.
Add the generated cover placeholder image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-gatsby.dim_600x900.png.
Add the generated cover placeholder image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-1984.dim_600x900.png.
Add the generated cover placeholder image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-mockingbird.dim_600x900.png.
Add the generated cover placeholder image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-alchemist.dim_600x900.png.

Wire frontend/public/assets/generated/chapter-one-hero.dim_1600x900.png into the hero as a background or prominent visual; replace any ‚ÄúCover Art‚Äù text with the corresponding cover images from frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-*.dim_600x900.png for each trending book card.

Reference the exact generated cover filenames (frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-gatsby.dim_600x900.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-1984.dim_600x900.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-mockingbird.dim_600x900.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/cover-alchemist.dim_600x900.png) in the static trending book data so cards can render images consistently.
